main event: Observed a round object pass overhead, described as larger than a conventional aircraft, emitting no sound, and passing from horizon to horizon in 1-3 seconds.
interesting points: The object was observed by two associates of the Virginia Institute of Marine Science., The observers described the object as having a size similar to a nickel held at arm's length., The sighting lasted only 1-3 seconds and left no apparent trail., The weather conditions were reported as clear with unlimited visibility., The object was concluded to be astronomical, likely a meteor.
sighted object: one round object in the sky
witness description: Associates of the Virginia Institute of Marine Science, Gloucester Point, Virginia
